skill.name: route-tester
skill.description: Test authenticated routes in the your project using cookie-based authentication. Use this skill when testing API endpoints, validating route functionality, or debugging authentication issues. Includes patterns for using test-auth-route.js and mock authentication.
skill.summary: Test authenticated routes in the your project using cookie-based authentication. Use this skill when...
skill.author: diet103

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only a SKILL.md markdown file. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access is present in the skill itself. The documentation describes testing patterns for local development environments using localhost services only.

content.value_statement: Testing authenticated API routes requires understanding JWT cookie authentication and Keycloak integration. This skill provides ready-to-use patterns for testing protected endpoints with proper authentication in local development environments.
actual_capabilities: Test authenticated API endpoints using cookie-based JWT tokens
Debug authentication issues with detailed troubleshooting guides
Use mock authentication for development-only testing
Verify database changes after testing routes
Construct full route URLs with proper prefixes
Handle POST, PUT, DELETE, and GET requests with authentication
limitations: Designed for local development environments only
Requires Keycloak and test credentials to be running locally
Mock authentication only works in development mode
Does not test production or remote environments

use_cases.title: Test new API endpoints
use_cases.description: Validate new routes work correctly with proper authentication before deploying to staging

use_cases.title: Verify route functionality
use_cases.description: Systematically test authenticated endpoints and verify database changes after test execution

use_cases.title: Debug auth issues
use_cases.description: Investigate 401 and 403 errors by following structured debugging patterns and checklists

prompt_templates.title: Basic Route Test
prompt_templates.prompt: Use route-tester to test the GET endpoint at http://localhost:3000/blog-api/api/users and verify it returns proper authenticated response

prompt_templates.title: POST with Data
prompt_templates.prompt: Use route-tester to test a POST request to the form submission endpoint with JSON payload for testing

prompt_templates.title: Debug Auth Error
prompt_templates.prompt: Use route-tester to debug why a protected route is returning 401 Unauthorized. Follow the troubleshooting checklist.

prompt_templates.title: Verify Database
prompt_templates.prompt: After testing a route that modifies data, verify the database changes using the patterns from route-tester documentation

best_practices: Always regenerate authentication tokens before testing to avoid 401 errors from expired tokens
Use mock authentication only in development environments, never in production
Verify database changes after testing routes that modify data to ensure integrity
anti_patterns: Testing production endpoints with test credentials creates security vulnerabilities
Skipping database verification after testing routes that modify data risks undetected issues
Using hardcoded credentials in scripts committed to version control exposes secrets

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill supports Claude and Claude Code. It provides documentation patterns that work with any AI assistant for API testing.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for testing?
faq.answer: Rate limits depend on your local Keycloak and database configuration. There are no imposed limits from this skill.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing test suite?
faq.answer: Copy the curl commands generated by test-auth-route.js into your test scripts or use them as reference for implementing programmatic tests.

faq.question: Is my test data safe?
faq.answer: This skill operates only in local development environments. No data leaves your machine when using the documented patterns.

faq.question: Why am I getting 401 errors?
faq.answer: Common causes: token expired, Keycloak not running, incorrect cookie format, or JWT secret mismatch. See the troubleshooting section for solutions.

faq.question: How does this compare to Postman or other tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides automation patterns for AI assistants. Postman offers a GUI for manual testing. Both can be used together effectively.
